findings.title: Pump.fun Bonding Curve Mechanics
findings.summary: Step-function bonding curve with 800M tokens. ~86 SOL to graduate to Raydium. $69K market cap triggers liquidity deposit. Early buyers get exponential gains.
keyInsights: 800M tokens in bonding curve, 1B total supply
~86 SOL needed to fill curve and graduate to Raydium
$69K mcap threshold triggers $12K liquidity deposit
Price increases exponentially as mcap grows
LP tokens burned after graduation - reduces supply
findings.verdict: Well-designed for fair launches. Key insight: early detection of promising launches = alpha.

findings.title: ElizaOS Framework Analysis
findings.summary: Leading open-source AI agent framework. 17.4k GitHub stars. Token migrated from $ai16z to $elizaOS (11B supply). $20B+ ecosystem. Multi-chain via CCIP.
keyInsights: 17.4k stars, 5.4k forks on GitHub
Model agnostic - supports all major LLMs
Web3 native - agents can trade onchain
Rebranded from ai16z for enterprise partnerships
findings.verdict: The 'Android' of AI agents - open source, widely adopted. Token has loose binding to product.

findings.title: Virtuals Protocol Deep Dive
findings.summary: AI agent launchpad on Base with $37M+ revenue. Tight token utility (all agent tokens pair with VIRTUAL). Down 80% from ATH. Fair-valued at current levels.
keyInsights: 17,000+ agents launched, ~$6.74B cumulative DEX volume
Tight token-product binding vs ai16z's open model
Solana expansion weak (8.3% graduation rate)
33% mindshare in AI agent sector
findings.verdict: Fair-valued to slightly undervalued. Small speculative allocation (1-3%) defensible.

findings.title: Agent Infrastructure Gaps Analysis
findings.summary: 8 major gaps identified: Identity/Auth, Wallets, Memory, Coordination, Monetization, Governance, Compute, Real-World Integration.
keyInsights: No universal agent identity/reputation system exists
Wallets aren't built for autonomous spending limits
Memory isn't portable between providers
<25% of orgs have scaled agents to production - coordination is the blocker
findings.verdict: Top opportunities: Agent Identity Protocol, Agent-Native Wallets, Portable Memory Vaults

findings.title: Moltbook Platform Analysis
findings.summary: Reddit-style social network for AI agents only. Built on OpenClaw. MOLT token at $54-78M mcap. Emergent behaviors fascinating, but token utility unclear.
keyInsights: Agents founding their own religions autonomously
Token feels bolted-on, platform works without it
Marc Andreessen attention = significant signal
Built on same infra as Clawdbot
findings.verdict: Watch as signal, avoid token unless pure meme bet
